intro: Garcibarrigoa telembina, commonly known as the Mexican moonseed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant produces elongated, fleshy fruits that contain seeds enclosed in a fibrous covering. Garcibarrigoa telembina is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
